notes: Attracts birds and bees. Flowers are edible.

common_name: yarrow; common yarrow; soldier's woundwort; nosebleed plant
plant_type: Ground Cover; Perennial; California Native; Herb
notes: Durable and reseeds easily--makes for a good erosion control and general groundcover. Flowers make it a staple in pollinator gardens. Medicinal value.
pruning_notes: Spreads by rhizomes - benefits from division every other year. Can become invasive.

plant_type: Tree; California Native; Summer Deciduous; Winter Deciduous
tol_conditions: drought; heat; poor soil; salt air; wind
pruning_notes: Only when necessary (e.g. crossing branches) and structure can be seen

plant_type: Ground Cover; Perennial; California Native; Herb
notes: Does not tolerate any direct sun. Can substitue rhizomes for culinary ginger.
Leaves can be used In tea and cooking. Medicinal value.
when_blooms: Apr; May; Jun; Jul; Aug; Sep

notes: Flannel-like leaves can irritate skin and eyes. Does not tolerate summer water! Naturally germinates following fire.
pruning_notes: Avoid hard pruning including cutting into woody stems.

when_blooms: Jan_int; Feb; Mar; Apr; May; Jun; Jul_int; Aug_int; Sep; Oct; Nov,Dec_int

notes: Cornerstone species for wildlife and surrounding ecosystem. Acorns attract birds and butterflies. Habitat and food host for over 270 species.
pruning_notes: Prune in dry weather when not growing to minimize pathogens. Avoid pruning large limbs due to slow recovery. Do not aggressively thin interior branches.

notes: Excellent wildlife host plant. Best planting choice within 5 to 10 miles of Coast--otherwise use Sugar Bush.
tol_conditions: drought; heat; poor soil; salt air; wind; clay soil; deer
when_blooms: Jan_int; Feb; Mar; Apr_int; May_int; Jun_int; Jul_int
pruning_notes: Prune or shear as desired at any time of year - hedge or tree forms.
